subject: Re: [junit] running test methods in order
msgSnippet: First off, you can control the order by explicitly setting up a TestSuite in a suite() method in the TestCase. That being said, I wouldn t introduce the order
messageBody:
First off, you can control the order by explicitly setting up a
TestSuite in a suite() method in the TestCase.

That being said, I wouldn't introduce the order dependency in running
the tests for unit/programmer tests. It sounds like your somewhere
in between a unit tests and a integration tests since you may be
depending on the external database, so...

If writing the suite method yourself doesn't sound like a good option,
you could just move this into one testXXX() and do the two inserts
and check in the test that the second fails, then clean up the
inserted record in tearDown().

"belingueres <gaby@...>" <gaby@...> writes:

> Hi,
>
> I need to test a simple insertion of a tuple into a data base table.
>
> First I set the table empty, then I test that an specific tuple is
> correctly inserted.
> Then, I try to insert the same tuple again, which would result in an
> exception, since its primary key is duplicated.
>
> Those tow tests I did it in two different testXXX() methods in the
> TestCase: testInsert() and testDuplicated()
>
> The thing is that JUnit runs first the testDuplicated() method and
> then the testInsert(), so the two tests fails!
>
> How can I assure myself that the two test methods run in a particular
> order?
>
> Is this a good testing practice?
>
> Thanks in advance,
> Gabriel


--
